intro: Schoenocrambe haydenii, commonly known as Hayden's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers and pungent odor, typical of the mustard family. It grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush communities. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
